location.name: Abeele
location.notes: There are two "Abeele"s, one in Belgium, one in France; tJP p.6 indicates the one in France

location.name: Aertrycke
location.notes: Modern Aartrijke

location.name: Aire
location.notes: OtF6.1 has this corresponding to Google's Aire-sur-la-Lys, used here

location.name: Aische-en-Refail
location.notes: tJP has "Aiche en Befail" (map) and "Aische-en-Befail" (gazetteer), but these appear to be typos. tJP map has this just outside Douai, but it's unlikely that Jastas 26+27 were there at the end of the war; this location in Belgium makes more sense.

location.name: Aincreville
location.notes: tJP has Aincrevillers and Ancrevillers, but Mapquest and calle.com have no such names

location.name: Arcy
location.notes: Apparently same as Arcy-sainte-restitue in Mapquest

location.name: Ars
location.notes: Apparently the same as Ars-sur-Moselle. calle.com gazetteer has numerous "Ars", but only this one looks plausible

location.name: Artemps
location.notes: Omitted from tJP map and gazetteer, but listed in the Jasta 20 airfields list

location.name: Athies
location.notes: OtF6.1 has this as Athies, Somme, Picardie, France -- not the Athies just northeast of Arras

location.name: Attigny
location.notes: Mapquest reports another Attigny in Lorraine

location.name: Auchy
location.notes: Modern Auchy-lez-Orchies; Mapquest reports five matches

location.name: Aulnoye
location.notes: tJP gazetteer lists this as a 6th Army location, but the p.4 map matches this location, Aulnoye-Aymeries in Google

location.name: Auritz
location.notes: Probably in Austria, actually

location.name: Autrecourt
location.notes: Autrecourt-et-Pourron. tJP consistently calls this "Antrecourt", but OtF19.2 lists "Autrecourt near Mouzon" (=Autrecourt-et-Pourron) where tJP has "Antrecourt"

location.name: Autremencourt
location.notes: Apparently missing from tJP map, but this location matches the 7th Army location listed in the gazetteer

location.name: Baisieux
location.notes: tJP gazetteer lists this as "W Albert" but Jasta 30 was there near the end of the war; Google lists "Baizieux" there, but surely this location is more likely?

location.name: Bailleul
location.notes: For some reason Google comes up with the location NW Amiens, but this location is clearly marked on their map and is correct per OtF6.1

location.name: Bazoches
location.notes: calle.com gazetteer has many Bazoches, but only Bazoches-sur-Vesle is in the right location

location.name: Beaulieu
location.notes: Not listed in OtF6.1, but this location, Beaulieu-les-Fontaines, is plausible

location.name: Beaumont Ferme
location.notes: calle.com has dozens of "Beaumont"s. Only Beaumont-en-Argonne is close to the position on tJP map

location.name: Beauvois
location.notes: calle.com has a few "Beauvois" entries; tJP gazetter has "Beauvois E Cambrai", which appears to be Beauvois-en-Cambrésis

location.name: Béchamps
location.notes: Listed as "Bechamp" in tJP

location.name: Bellevue
location.notes: OtF6.1 has this location (apparently different than Bellevue) about at the location of Google's Monceau-lès-Leups

location.name: Bellevue Ferme
location.notes: Location given in Albatros Publication's Jagdstaffel 5, volume 1

location.name: Bellincamps
location.notes: Apparently a chateau near Thumeries

location.name: Besny-Soisy
location.notes: "Besny et Soisy" in tJP map, assumed equivalent to "Besny-et-Loizy" in Google; apparently missing from tJP map

location.name: Béthencourt
location.notes: OtF6.1 indicates the location SE of Cambrai

location.name: Beuvry
location.notes: Appears to be Beuvry-Nord, aka Beuvry-les-Orehies

location.name: Beveren
location.notes: Mapquest has four "Beveren"s in Flanders, three of which are in West Flanders: 1) NE of Courtrai; 2) Between Ypres and Dunkirk; 3) NE Roeselare, equidistant from Ypres and Courtrai (which most closely corresponds to the tJP map)

location.name: Bisseghem
location.notes: Google's Bissegem

location.name: Blaise
location.notes: Mapquest has two "Blaise"s in Champagne-Ardenne, but only the northern one's location is reasonable.

location.name: Blangermont
location.notes: Google's Blangerval-Blangermont

location.name: Bohain
location.notes: Mapquest's "Bohain-en-vermandois"

location.name: Boistrancourt
location.notes: Airfields & Airmen: Cambrai, p. 76, notes this is same as Estourmel

location.name: Boncourt
location.notes: Mapquest has four "Boncourt"s, none of which match the tJP map location; the choice seemed between Picardy and Lorraine, of which the former better matches the 7th Army location

location.name: Bonneuil Ferme
location.notes: Same as Golancourt according to OtF6.1

location.name: Bourlers
location.notes: tJP map shows this in France, but Mapquest reports no "Bourlers" in France, and this Belgian town is in the right Army sector.

location.name: Boussières
location.notes: Google's Boussières-en-Cambrésis

location.name: Bouvincourt
location.notes: Bouvincourt-en-Vermandois

location.name: Bruay
location.notes: Bruary-la-Buissière

location.name: Bruille
location.notes: Mapquest has both Bruille-lez-Marchiennes and Bruille-Saint-Amand in Nord-Pas-de-Calais; tJP p. 6 and the map seem to be the former

location.name: Bryas
location.notes: OtF6.1 agrees with this spelling; corresponds with Google's "Brias"

location.name: Bühl
location.notes: There are two in Lorraine; Mapquest's "Bühl-Lorraine" corresponds with tJP map and p.7

location.name: Carignan
location.notes: tJP map apparently has two 59's, one east of Arras, the other southeast of Sedan, neither corresponding very well to Mapquest's location

location.name: Carrépuis
location.notes: tJP omits the accent over the "e", but I went with Mapquest's version

location.name: Castern
location.notes: Mapquest has no "Castern" in DE, FR, BE, or LU; but there's a "Kaster" in Belgium that appears plausible; that's what I've used here

location.name: Castres
location.notes: Apparently omitted from tJP map

location.name: Ceune
location.notes: Appears to correspond with Mapquest's "Kuurne"

location.name: Charmois
location.notes: Mapquest has two "Charmois", one even in Lorraine, but neither near where tJP map places it in the 5th Army area. calle.com has a Charmois at 49N 5E which looks to be correct, but it's not in Mapquest. Since tJP gazetteer says "Charmois, S Stenay", I've arbitrarily located this 1mi south of Stenay

location.name: Chassonge Ferme
location.notes: tJP has "Chassogne Ferme", but OtF6.1 has "Chassonge Ferme" at this location

location.name: Chéméry
location.notes: calle.com has several "Chémery"s, but from the tJP map, this is Chémery-sur-Bar.

location.name: Chéry-les-Pouilly
location.notes: Mapquest omits the accent in "Chéry"

location.name: Chévresis-Monceau
location.notes: Mapquest omits the accent in "Chévresis"

location.name: Chuffilly
location.notes: Corresponds to Mapquest Chuffilly-Roche? The position is a little off compared to tJP map

location.name: Cohartville
location.notes: Mapquest has no "Cohartville", but does have "Froidmont-Cohartille" in approximately the right location ... that's what I used

location.name: Compiègne
location.notes: The actual airfield was unlikely to be in the center of town (shown on the map) but OtF6.1 indicated no nearby airfield

location.name: Conteville
location.notes: Google's Conteville-en-Temois

location.name: Coxyde
location.notes: Modern Koksijde

location.name: Cuerne
location.notes: Google's Kuurne

location.name: Délinge Ferme
location.notes: No reference in Mapquest, Google, or OtF6.1

location.name: Doncourt
location.notes: Mapquest has four "Doncourt"s, three in Lorraine. Doncourt-aux-Templiers seems to best match the tJP map

location.name: Droglandt
location.notes: Google's Droogland

location.name: Ellignies
location.notes: Mapquest has "Ellignies-Sainte-Anne"

location.name: Ennemain-Falvy Rd
location.notes: Falvy road leads south out of Ennemain; I've guessed that the aerodrome was 1/3rd mile south of Ennemain

location.name: Escaufourt
location.notes: tJP consistently uses "Escaufort", but that's evidently a typo

location.name: Estrées-en-Chaussée
location.notes: OtF6.1 has "Estrees-en-Chausle" (which appears to be a typo for "Estrées-en-Chausée") in the index ... but the map has no reference. This location is Google's Estrées-Mons, which appears to be the correct location.

location.name: Faches
location.notes: Mapquest has Faches-Thumesnil

location.name: Famechon
location.notes: Google has three Famechons, but OtF6.1 indicates this location in Nord-Pas-de-Calais

location.name: Flaumont
location.notes: Google's Flaumont-Waudrechies

location.name: Fleurs
location.notes: Assumed the same as Mapquest's "Fleurus"

location.name: Flez
location.notes: tJP has "Flez-Suisaucourt"; is this a typo for Flez-Guizancourt? Mapquest and calle.com don't have that, either ... but Airfields & Airmen: Cambrai (and Google) locates it west of Saint-Quentin at the intersection of A29 and the D937

location.name: Fonfry
location.notes: Nothing close to "Fonfry" or "Foufry" in Mapquest or calle.com; since tJP gazetteer calls it "Fonfry, N Fère-en-Tardenois", I've arbitrarily chosen a location a mile north of Fère-en-Tardenois

location.name: Fontaine Notre Dame
location.notes: Mapquest has two in the area, one WSW of Cambrai, and one ENE of St Quentin. tJP map uses the latter

location.name: Fontaine-sur-May
location.notes: Constable data and OtF6.1 agree on this spelling, but this is Google's "Fontaine-sur-Maye" (with the "e" on the end)

location.name: Ford Farm
location.notes: Ten of these about in the UK

location.name: Foucaucourt
location.notes: Mapquest has two "Foucaucourt"s in Picardy: "Foucaucourt-en-Santerre" and "Foucaucourt-hors-Nesle". The former is closer to the tJP location

location.name: Froidmont
location.notes: Mapquest's "Froidmont-cohartille"; tJP gazetteer has "Froidemont", but this looks like a typo

location.name: Furnes
location.notes: Google's Veurne

location.name: Grandmetz
location.notes: tJP has "Grand Metz", but Mapquest and calle.com have it as one word

location.name: Gross-Tanchen
location.notes: As noted on tJP map, modern "Grostenquin"

location.name: Guisecourt
location.notes: No town by this name in Mapquest or calle.com. Since this aerodrome was only used by Jastas 12, 13, 15, 19 for a few days during the Kaiserschlact, and all were previously at Roupy and afterwards at Balâtre, I think this corresponds to "Guiscard", which is between those two locations and has a name phonetically similar to "Guisecourt".

location.name: Guizancourt
location.notes: Mapquest has two "Guizancourt"s in Picardy, but this one best matches the tJP map

location.name: Halluin
location.notes: Mapquest has "Heuvelland" in same place; I've assumed they're equivalent

location.name: Harmigniers
location.notes: Mapquest has "Harmignies"

location.name: Hennieches Ferme
location.notes: tJP map spells it "Hennechies Ferme", but Mapquest has neither

location.name: Hesdigneul
location.notes: Google's Hesdigneul-lès-Béthune

location.name: Hoog Huis
location.notes: Based on OtF6.1, seems to be Google's Point du Jour

location.name: Houplin
location.notes: Mapquest has "Houplin-Ancoisne"

location.name: Hove
location.notes: Mapquest has another "Hove", but it's off near Antwerp

location.name: Inchy
location.notes: Not to be confused with Inchy-en-Artois, which is what comes up by default on Google; this location confirmed by OtF6.1

location.name: Ingelmünster
location.notes: Mapquest omits the umlaut over the "u"

location.name: Iwuy
location.notes: missing from tJP map + gazetteer

location.name: Izel-le-Hameau
location.notes: Google's Izel-les-Hameux, but OtF has the singular form of the name

location.name: Koekhoek
location.notes: tJP gazetteer has "Koekhoek, nr Menin"; phonetically this is close to OtF6.1's Coucou near Menin, which location I have used for this

location.name: Kruishoutem
location.notes: tJP has "Kroishouten" (gazetteer), "Kroishausen" (map), but this is almost certainly "Kruihoutem"

location.name: Kuerne
location.notes: Mapquest has "Kuurne"

location.name: La Bonne Maison Ferme
location.notes: OtF6.1 has "Bonne Maison Ferme"

location.name: La Brayelles
location.notes: on tJP map (as Brayelles) but nowhere in Mapquest or Google; OtF6.1 lists its location as "W Douai?" so estimated here

location.name: La Capelle
location.notes: Mapquest finds six La Capelles, but the others are in southern France

location.name: La Chaussée
location.notes: between Laon and Mezieres on tJP map, but no such location in OtF6.1, Google, or Mapquest

location.name: La Ferté Ferme
location.notes: I assumed this is the same as OtF6.1's "La Ferté Chevresis"

location.name: La Jolly Ferme
location.notes: listed in OtF6.1 index, but no corresponding location; tJP gazetteer has "La Jolly Ferme, Stenay", so I used Stenay's location

location.name: La Neuville
location.notes: Position on tJP map seems to match Mapquest's "Neuville", used here

location.name: La Panne
location.notes: Modern De Panne

location.name: Lagnicourt-Marcel
location.notes: tJP has "Lagnicourt", but Mapquest and calle.com agree on "Lagnicourt-Marcel"

location.name: Lalovie
location.notes: Constable data has this consistently as "La Lovie"; it's in OtF6.1 w/o the space

location.name: Le Châtelet
location.notes: no such place in Google, Mapquest, or OtF6.1

location.name: Le Clos Ferme
location.notes: tJP gazetteer lists as "Le Clos Ferme, Boncourt"

location.name: Le Hameau
location.notes: no OTF6.1 reference, but this location from Google seems plausible

location.name: Le Mesnil, Nesle
location.notes: Location is Nesle in the Somme region from Mapquest

location.name: Le Quesnoy
location.notes: OtF6.1 shows this location to be correct of several "Le Quesnoy"s

location.name: Léchelle
location.notes: There are two, but one is too far to the south

location.name: Leffrinckhoucke
location.notes: Google's Leffrinckoucke

location.name: Lieu-St.-Armand
location.notes: tJP omits the dashes

location.name: Liernu
location.notes: tJP has "Lirm" and "Lierm", but there's no location by that name in Mapquest or calle.com. I've assumed that this is a typo for "Liernu".

location.name: Magneux
location.notes: tJP has "Magneuse-Villete" for J1, "Magneux" for J81; Mapquest and calle.com agree on "Magneux". tJP map location seems to be on the wrong side of Reims

location.name: Maisoncelle
location.notes: OtF6.1 has this as "Maisoncelles"

location.name: Malmy-Cheméry
location.notes: Google's "Malmy"

location.name: Marle
location.notes: tJP map+gazetteer: Marle-Autremencourt. calle.com shows two "Marle"s; this one is aka Marle-et-Behaine

location.name: Martincourt-sur-Meuse
location.notes: JP has "Martincourt"; this is the one (of three) that matches the map

location.name: Merchin
location.notes: In OtF6.1 but not Google; appears to be overrun by Lille urban area, at the intersection of the A27 and the A23.

location.name: Mercy-le-Haut
location.notes: tJP has "Mercy-le-Haute", but Mapquest and calle.com agree on "Mercy-le-Haut"

location.name: Merville
location.notes: Mapquest has three in France, but only one is near the front, its location agreeing with OtF6.1.

location.name: Metz-Frescaty
location.notes: Mapquest and calle.com have no town of this name; is it the location of the modern airport? If so, tJP map location is almost 20mi off the real location

location.name: Meuines
location.notes: Nothing like "Meuines" in Mapquest or Google. tJP gazetteer has "Meuines, Courtrai"; "Moen" is phonetically close to this and in the Courtrai area, so that's what I've used here

location.name: Mitau
location.notes: No idea where this is, other than eastern front

location.name: Monceau-le-Waast
location.notes: tJP map has "Monceau le Wast"; p23 has "Montceau-le-Wast"; Mapquest has the given spelling

location.name: Mons-en-Pévèle
location.notes: tJP gazetteer and text have this as "Mons en Pevelle", but the map is apparently correct; calle.com notes "Mons-en-Peyele", "Mons-en-Puelle" (and others) as aliases

location.name: Mont
location.notes: There are dozens of "Mont"s in France. tJP gazetteer calls this "Mont, NE Verdun", but none of the "Mont"s are there; I've used "Mont-devant-Sassey" here because even though it's NW of Verdun, it's in about the right area given the skewed tJP map.

location.name: Mont de Soissons Ferme
location.notes: tJP gazetteer and Jasta listings have "Mont Soissons Ferme", but the map and OtF6.1 agree that the name includes "de"

location.name: Mont-d'Origny
location.notes: tJP omits the dash in the name

location.name: Mont-Notre-Dame
location.notes: tJP omits the dashes

location.name: Mont-St.-Martin
location.notes: tJP omits the dashes in the name. There are four "Mont-Saint-Martin"s in France; one in the south, which can be ignored for these purposes, one near the France/Belgium/Luxembourg border, one east of Reims, and one west of Reims. From comparing dates, the front line, and Jasta positions before and after being stationed here, it appears that the town west of Reims is the aerodrome.

location.name: Montigny Ferme
location.notes: listed in OtF6.1 but with no location; Google has ten Montignys, many in plausible areas

location.name: Möntingen
location.notes: A note on the tJP map says "Möntingen is modern Montoy; this is Montoy-Flanville in Mapquest; it seems to be missing from calle.com

location.name: Mörchingen
location.notes: per note on tJP map, modern day "Morhange"

location.name: Morsberg
location.notes: No such city as "Morsberg" in Mapquest or calle.com in France, Germany, Belgium, or Luxembourg. Is this "Morsbach", whose location I've used here?

location.name: Mousecron
location.notes: Mapquest has Mouscron

location.name: Moyencourt
location.notes: There's also Moyencourt-lès-Poix, but this is the correct one

location.name: Neumünster
location.notes: Modern Nieuwmunster

location.name: Neuville
location.notes: There are dozens of "Neuville"s in France, several not far from this location, but this seems to match the tJP map most closely

location.name: Neuvilly
location.notes: There are at least two in France, but this most closely matches the position on the tJP map

location.name: Norman-le-West
location.notes: Nothing close in calle.com; listed in OtF6.1 but without coordinates

location.name: Origny-St.-Benoite
location.notes: tJP omits the dashes

location.name: Ostend
location.notes: Modern Oostende

location.name: Pezarche
location.notes: OtF6.1 note: same as Touquin

location.name: Pontfaverger-Moronvilliers
location.notes: tJP lists as "Pont Faverger", but Mapquest and calle.com agree on "Pontfaverger-Moronvilliers"

location.name: Poperinghe
location.notes: Modern Poperinge

location.name: Prémont
location.notes: tJP has "Premont"

location.name: Preutin-Higny
location.notes: tJP map has it correct, but the gazetteer and Jasta lists have "Prentin-Higny"; looks like a typo

location.name: Procher
location.notes: tJP can't decide whether this is in 4 Army area (gazetteer) or 5 Army area (p21). No such name or anything phonetically close that I could find in Belgium, France, Luxembourg, or Germany; not listed in OtF6.1

location.name: Puisieux Ferme
location.notes: from OtF6.1

location.name: Puxieux
location.notes: tJP map has "Pusieux", gazetteer has "Pusieux, Mars-la-Tour"; but OtF has "Puxieux" in that location, so I've assumed tJP is a propagated typo

location.name: Reneuil Ferme
location.notes: no matches in Mapquest or OtF6.1, but found "Reneuil" on Google in plausible llocation

location.name: Retheuil Ferme
location.notes: tJP gazetteer has this as "Retheuil Ferme, Bohain" so I used the airfield location near Bohain from OtF6.1.

location.name: Riencourt-les-Cagnicourt
location.notes: tJP uses "Riencourt" or "Rienncourt, Arras"; of the several "Riencourt"s in France, this appears to be the correct one

location.name: Rocourt-St.-Martin
location.notes: tJP omits the dashes

location.name: Roulers
location.notes: =Roeselare in Mapquest

location.name: St.-André-au-Bois
location.notes: Modern Gouy-St-André

location.name: St.-Christ
location.notes: tJP omits the dash

location.name: St.-Gérard
location.notes: tJP omits the dash

location.name: St.-Gérard Maison
location.notes: tJP shows this as a separate airfield, but browsing the area in Mapquest gives no clue as to where this should be. I've guessed that it's a mile north of St.Gérard

location.name: St.-Gobert
location.notes: tJP omits the dash in the name

location.name: St.-Loup-Champagne
location.notes: tJP map: "St Loup", gazetteer: "St Loup, Champagne"; calle.com as given here

location.name: St.-Mard
location.notes: tJP map location can't be correct, since it's behind Allied (pre-Kaiserschlacht) lines. Mapquest appears to have an indexing bug, as searching for "Saint-Mard" turns up ten locations, none of which are near the tJP map spot. But searching for Soissons, zooming in, and following D884 east, it's there, just west of Viel-Arcy.

location.name: St.-Marguerite
location.notes: tJP has "St. Marguerite", but calle.com and Mapquest use the dash. Mapquest appears to have an indexing bug, as searching for "Sainte-Marguerite" turns up ten locations, none of which are at the right spot. But by searching for Lille, zooming in, and following the D308 to the northwest, there's a Sainte-Marguerite in the proper location

location.name: St. Medard
location.notes: Missing from tJP map. There are many "Saint Medard"s in France, but this location in Belgium seems most probable, given that it was in use when the German army was retreating at the end of 1918

location.name: St.-Pol
location.notes: St.-Pol-sur-Ternoise

location.name: St.-Quentin
location.notes: It's unlikely the airfield was at this point, in the center of town, but OtF6.1 doesn't show a nearby airfield, except those named something else

location.name: St.-Quentin-le-Petit
location.notes: tJP omits the dash between "Saint" and "Quentin", but calle.com explicitly includes it

location.name: St.-Rémy-le-Petit West
location.notes: tJP omits the dash between "Saint" and "Rémy", but calle.com explicitly includes it

location.name: Sailly
location.notes: calle.com has many Sailly; tJP map location most closely corresponds with Sailly-les-Lannoy, which is what I've used here

location.name: Santes
location.notes: tJP has "Sante Nord"; there are no "Sante"s in Mapquest or calle.com but Mapquest shows a "Santes" in about the same location as tJP map.

location.name: Semide
location.notes: tJP has "Sémide", but Mapquest and calle.com gazetteer agree on "Semide"

location.name: Séranvillers
location.notes: tJP has "Seranvillers"

location.name: Sierenz
location.notes: Mapquest has "Sierentz"

location.name: Sivry
location.notes: The "Sivry" in Mapquest is south of Metz and not in the 5 Army sector. Calle.com gazetteer has six "Sivrey"s, of which "Sivry-sur-Meuse" looks to be the proper match (and so is used here)

location.name: Spultier
location.notes: Not in Mapquest or calle.com gazetteer; since tJP has "Spultier, Wavre" (p. 11 w/transposition typo and p.16) I've used Wavre itself as the location,

location.name: Staceghem
location.notes: Google's Stasegem

location.name: Suzanne
location.notes: There's another Suzanne in the Ardennes

location.name: Tellancourt
location.notes: Not sure if this was German in 1914 or not

location.name: Thin-le-Moutier
location.notes: tJP gazetteer and map have "Thin le Montier", but this appears to be a typo

location.name: Thourout
location.notes: Mapquest has "Torhout"

location.name: Thouroube
location.notes: No entry in Mapquest nor Calle.com World Index; tJP gazetteer notes it "E Roulers", so I've arbitrarily placed it two miles due E of Roulers (=Roeselare)

location.name: Thuillies
location.notes: tJP has "Thuilles", but that doesn't exist in Mapquest

location.name: Tichémont
location.notes: Not in Mapquest. Google search turns up a "Château et parc" at Giraumont, which is about its location on tJP map. The tJP map has it SE of Giraumont, but the Mapquest Giraumont map has a "Lieu-Dit Tichemont" road (path?) intersecting the D152 NW of the city, which is where I guess it is

location.name: Treizennes
location.notes: Modern Trézenne on Google Maps

location.name: Varsenere
location.notes: tJP calls it Varsenaere

location.name: Vaux
location.notes: tJP map has just "Vaux"; gazetteer has "Vaux, Somme". Assume this is Mapquest's Vaux-sur-somme

location.name: Vauxcéré
location.notes: tJP text uses Vaucère, but Vauxcéré (as on the p.5 map) is correct according to Mapquest

location.name: Villers-campeau
location.notes: tJP has "Schloss Villers Campeau"

location.name: Villers-le-Sec
location.notes: Mapquest has 4 Villers-le-sec; only one is in the 18th Army area.

location.name: Villers-sire-nicole
location.notes: tJP text and gazetter have "Villers-sur-Nicole", though map has it correct

location.name: Vraignes
location.notes: tJP map has "Vraignies". Mapquest has two locations: Vraignes-lès-Hornoy, about 15mi west of Amiens, and Vraignes-en-Vermandois near St. Quentin, which seems to be the correct one

location.name: Wancourt Ferme
location.notes: Used Wancourt on Mapquest

location.name: Warloy
location.notes: Google's Warloy-Baillon

location.name: Xivry-Circourt
location.notes: tJP has "Hivry-Circourt"; I'm unsure if this is a typo or the name changed after the war

location.name: Zweveghem
location.notes: Google's Zwevegem
